header: 1 Cri. Bail Application No. 17/2019 ORDER BELOW EXH. 1 MHPU14-000088-2019

background.text: 1] Present application is filed by the accused namely Dipak Shankar Shinde (accused no.2) with request to grant him bail, u/s. 439 of the Code of Criminal Procedure-1973 against whom Crime No. 1069 of 2018, is registered with Baramati City police station (District–Pune) for having committed offence punishable U/ss. 363, 306 r/w 34 of Indian Penal Code.

legalActFound.stringMatched: u/s. 439 of the code of criminal procedure
u/ss. 363, 306 r/w 34 of indian penal code

arguments.text: 2] It is prosecution case that on 21/12/2018 daughter of the informant was kidnapped from the school later on it was revealed the applicant-accused and another kidnapped daughter of the informant. It was also revealed on the same day daughter of the informant committed suicide. It is prosecution case, applicant- accused and another abeted commission of the suicide done by daughter of the informant. It is prosecution case, on getting information of the offence, case is registered against the applicant- accused and one another.

argumentSentences.text: 2] It is prosecution case that on 21/12/2018 daughter of the informant was kidnapped from the school later on it was revealed the applicant-accused and another kidnapped daughter of the informant.
It was also revealed on the same day daughter of the informant committed suicide.
It is prosecution case, applicant- accused and another abeted commission of the suicide done by daughter of the informant.
It is prosecution case, on getting information of the offence, case is registered against the applicant- accused and one another.

arguments.text: 3] Learned advocate Mr. Pataskar appearing for the applicant-accused submitted arguments in the line of application filed.

argumentSentences.text: 3] Learned advocate Mr. Pataskar appearing for the applicant-accused submitted arguments in the line of application filed.

arguments.text: 4] He submitted intention on the part of the accused is important consideration while deciding bail application. Existence of the evidence against the accused indicating involvement of the accused is another point of consideration while deciding bail application and it also need to be taken into consideration keeping accused behind the bar as serious refer-cations. In support of submissions made he placed reliance upon the ratio laid down in the following mentioned cases - 1. Chitresh Kumar Chopra V/s. State (Govt. of NCT of Delhi), MANU/SC/1453/2009. 2. Sanju V/s. State of M. P., MANU/SC/0392/2002. 3. Gangular Mohan Reddy V/s. State of A.P. MANU/SC/0001/2010. 4. Sanjay Chandra V/s. CBI, MANU/SC/1375/2011.

argumentSentences.text: 4] He submitted intention on the part of the accused is important consideration while deciding bail application.

Existence of the evidence against the accused indicating involvement of the accused is another point of consideration while deciding bail application and it also need to be taken into consideration keeping accused behind the bar as serious refer-cations.
In support of submissions made he placed reliance upon the ratio laid down in the following mentioned cases - 1.
Chitresh Kumar Chopra V/s. State (Govt.
of NCT of Delhi), MANU/SC/1453/2009.
Sanju V/s. State of M. P., MANU/SC/0392/2002.
Gangular Mohan Reddy V/s. State of A.P. MANU/SC/0001/2010.
Sanjay Chandra V/s. CBI, MANU/SC/1375/2011.

arguments.text: 5] Per contra, learned APP Mr. Joshi submitted arguments in the line of say submitted by the prosecution and strongly opposed request made.

argumentSentences.text: 5] Per contra, learned APP Mr. Joshi submitted arguments in the line of say submitted by the prosecution and strongly opposed request made.

arguments.text: 6] On behalf of the informant learned Advocate Mr. Sonawane submitted arguments in the line of affidavit filed by the informant.

argumentSentences.text: 6] On behalf of the informant learned Advocate Mr. Sonawane submitted arguments in the line of affidavit filed by the informant.

arguments.text: 7] I have given anxious thought to the arguments advanced. I have also perused police papers produced for examination and documentary evidence produced on behalf of the accused. I have also gone through the affidavit filed by the informant and the ratio laid down in the cited cases.

argumentSentences.text: 7] I have given anxious thought to the arguments advanced.
I have also perused police papers produced for examination and documentary evidence produced on behalf of the accused.
I have also gone through the affidavit filed by the informant and the ratio laid down in the cited cases.

arguments.text: 8] Nature of the offence alleged to have committed by the applicant-accused is serious. Material collected by the prosecution indicates involvement of the applicant-accused in the commission of crime. It appears, victim girl was in contact with another accused Suraj and the applicant-accused also. Material collected shows, applicant-accused had visited spot where victim girl committed suicide. Further investigation is in progress. In such situation, if request made is accepted, then it would adversely affect on the progress of the investigation and possibility of tampering of the evidence also cannot be overlooked.

argumentSentences.text: 8] Nature of the offence alleged to have committed by the applicant-accused is serious.
Material collected by the prosecution indicates involvement of the applicant-accused in the commission of crime.
It appears, victim girl was in contact with another accused Suraj and the applicant-accused also.
Material collected shows, applicant-accused had visited spot where victim girl committed suicide.
Further investigation is in progress.
In such situation, if request made is accepted, then it would adversely affect on the progress of the investigation and possibility of tampering of the evidence also cannot be overlooked.

arguments.text: 9] As facts of the present application are somehow different, ratio laid down in the cited cases cannot be made applicable to the facts of present case as it is. 10] In the result, following order is passed :-

argumentSentences.text: 9] As facts of the present application are somehow different, ratio laid down in the cited cases cannot be made applicable to the facts of present case as it is.
10] In the result, following order is passed :-

order.text: ORDER Bail application stands rejected. Accordingly order is passed and the bail application stands disposed of.

processedText:
1 Cri. Bail Application No. 17/2019 ORDER BELOW EXH. 1 MHPU14-000088-2019 
---header-ends---
1] Present application is filed by the accused namely Dipak Shankar Shinde (accused no.2) with request to grant him bail, u/s. 439 of the Code of Criminal Procedure-1973 against whom Crime No. 1069 of 2018, is registered with Baramati City police station (District–Pune) for having committed offence punishable U/ss. 363, 306 r/w 34 of Indian Penal Code. 
---background-ends---
2] It is prosecution case that on 21/12/2018 daughter of the informant was kidnapped from the school later on it was revealed the applicant-accused and another kidnapped daughter of the informant. It was also revealed on the same day daughter of the informant committed suicide. It is prosecution case, applicant- accused and another abeted commission of the suicide done by daughter of the informant. It is prosecution case, on getting information of the offence, case is registered against the applicant- accused and one another. 
---argument-ends---
3] Learned advocate Mr. Pataskar appearing for the applicant-accused submitted arguments in the line of application filed. 
---argument-ends---
4] He submitted intention on the part of the accused is important consideration while deciding bail application. Existence of the evidence against the accused indicating involvement of the accused is another point of consideration while deciding bail application and it also need to be taken into consideration keeping accused behind the bar as serious refer-cations. In support of submissions made he placed reliance upon the ratio laid down in the following mentioned cases - 1. Chitresh Kumar Chopra V/s. State (Govt. of NCT of Delhi), MANU/SC/1453/2009. 2. Sanju V/s. State of M. P., MANU/SC/0392/2002. 3. Gangular Mohan Reddy V/s. State of A.P. MANU/SC/0001/2010. 4. Sanjay Chandra V/s. CBI, MANU/SC/1375/2011. 
---argument-ends---
5] Per contra, learned APP Mr. Joshi submitted arguments in the line of say submitted by the prosecution and strongly opposed request made. 
---argument-ends---
6] On behalf of the informant learned Advocate Mr. Sonawane submitted arguments in the line of affidavit filed by the informant. 
---argument-ends---
7] I have given anxious thought to the arguments advanced. I have also perused police papers produced for examination and documentary evidence produced on behalf of the accused. I have also gone through the affidavit filed by the informant and the ratio laid down in the cited cases. 
---argument-ends---
8] Nature of the offence alleged to have committed by the applicant-accused is serious. Material collected by the prosecution indicates involvement of the applicant-accused in the commission of crime. It appears, victim girl was in contact with another accused Suraj and the applicant-accused also. Material collected shows, applicant-accused had visited spot where victim girl committed suicide. Further investigation is in progress. In such situation, if request made is accepted, then it would adversely affect on the progress of the investigation and possibility of tampering of the evidence also cannot be overlooked. 
---argument-ends---
9] As facts of the present application are somehow different, ratio laid down in the cited cases cannot be made applicable to the facts of present case as it is. 10] In the result, following order is passed :- 
---argument-ends---
ORDER Bail application stands rejected. Accordingly order is passed and the bail application stands disposed of. 
---order-ends---
Baramati ( R.B. Deshpande) 22.01.2019 Addl. Sessions Judge, Baramati CERTIFICATE “ I affirm that the contents of this PDF file Judgment are same word for word as per original Judgment.
